results.title: Legacy : a promise for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Six members of Melbourne Legacy give their individual stories of how they got into contact with Legacy. Whether they are survivors of war, employees of Legacy or the children of soldiers, Legacy manages make a significant impression on the lives of its members and provides inspiration for future generations.
results.title_for_label: Legacy : a promise for the future : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Times have changed
results.creator_credit: Lillian Murray, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lillian Murray has worked in the offices of Legacy in Melbourne’s CBD for the last 29 years. It is her home away from home and she reflects on the technological changes there as well as the good times and the great people she has the pleasure to work with.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lillian Murray, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Realisation
results.creator_credit: Scott Percival, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Scott Percival thought he and his friends from Legacy were going to Perth for a little R&R. While he didn’t get the rest he’d hoped for, he got more than he could have imagined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Percival, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Passing the baton on
results.creator_credit: Margot Firth-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Margot Firth-Smith’s beloved father returned from the war, he came back a very old man and died soon after. To fill the gap, Firth-Smith joined Legacy which set her off on a rewarding life helping others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margot Firth-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My truth
results.creator_credit: Vladimir Keca, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vladimir Keca lived a sheltered life in a remote part of the former Yugoslavia with his grandparents. But once war broke out, he was removed from his comfort zone and, while it changed everything, Keca is not so sure that it was all bad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vladimir Keca, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dobbyn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. A baby boomer with a war veteran father, Dobbyn’s family did what they could to help the wives and children of those who didn’t return from the war. Despite this, Dobbyn felt he could be doing more and highlights two events in his life that showed him just how lucky he is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Dobbyn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. A baby boomer with a war veteran father, Dobbyn’s family did what they could to help the wives and children of those who didn’t return from the war. Despite this, Dobbyn felt he could be doing more and highlights two events in his life that showed him just how lucky he is.
description_for_label: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. A baby boomer with a war veteran father, Dobbyn’s family did what they could to help the wives and children of those who didn’t return from the war. Despite this, Dobbyn felt he could be doing more and highlights two events in his life that showed him just how lucky he is.

results.title: 1946 : my first year nursing
results.creator_credit: Jean Cussen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Jean Cussen’s father returned from the war, she took up nursing at the Children’s Hospital in Carlton. She provides, in rich detail, her time there, the children she cared for and how caring for these poor children brought the staff so much pleasure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Cussen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Jean Cussen’s father returned from the war, she took up nursing at the Children’s Hospital in Carlton. She provides, in rich detail, her time there, the children she cared for and how caring for these poor children brought the staff so much pleasure.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future
results.brief_description: Eight young people from Melbourne’s west share their stories of family, identity and the incidents that have changed their lives. Created as part of the Digital Storytelling program ‘Western stories: expressions for the future’ at ACMI.

results.title: Street kids
results.creator_credit: Dmitry Schukin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: From Russia to Werribee, via the gangs of Los Angeles and Las Vegas, Dmitry Schukin’s story is one of redemption through art. He talks openly about the crimes of his past and the pursuits that have helped him channel all the negative into something positive and given Schukin something to fight for.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dmitry Schukin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: From Russia to Werribee, via the gangs of Los Angeles and Las Vegas, Dmitry Schukin’s story is one of redemption through art. He talks openly about the crimes of his past and the pursuits that have helped him channel all the negative into something positive and given Schukin something to fight for.

results.title: Ride
results.creator_credit: Matthew Hunt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Matt Hunt talks candidly about his all-consuming addiction: riding bikes. It is an obsession that has changed the way he looks at the world, cost him physically and financially but one that he is not likely to give up soon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Matthew Hunt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
